column19: verdict
column20: betting_forecast
column36: comment
column37: spotlight

column4: Howden Graduation Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/6 Firefox, 9/4 Iroko, 100/30 James Du Berlais
column36: Comfortable winner on return; reliable and tactically versatile; seems sure to go well
column37: Smart performer who showed himself better than ever when making winning reappearance in five-runner Grade 2 event at Down Royal (2m3f, good to yielding) last month, comfortably asserting; reliable and tactically versatile; seems sure to go well.

column4: Howden Graduation Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/6 Firefox, 9/4 Iroko, 100/30 James Du Berlais
column36: Winner at Punchestown festival in April; stiff task last time; player if recapturing best
column37: Only 2-17 over fences but one of those wins came in fine style in handicap at the Punchestown festival (2m4f, yielding) in April; faced a stiff task in Grade 1 there (50-1) on reappearance; should come on for that run and he'll be a major player if recapturing his best.

column4: Howden Graduation Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/6 Firefox, 9/4 Iroko, 100/30 James Du Berlais
column36: Fourth in last year's Grand National; pleasing second on reappearance; good form chance
column37: Went off favourite for the Grand National in April and finished a highly creditable fourth; shaped nicely when second to a promising type in 2m5f graduation chase at Haydock last month; may prove best at 3m+ in the long term but he is not short of speed and he has every chance on the figures.

column4: Karen Codd Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mount Gay Run, 5/1 Fresh Kicks,  Buzz Iceclear, 6/1 Jakar Du Moulin, 13/2 Havefunontherun, 7/1 Dixie Mafia,  Doctor Midas, 10/1 Duel Au Soleil, 14/1 Gasmani
column36: Easy winner of a 2m4f maiden last time; upped in trip with his pointing background
column37: His Kempton conqueror two runs back has since run quite well in a Grade 2 and this 5yo was much too good for his rivals when 1-3 for a 2m4f maiden at Plumpton (soft); pointing background and should raise his profile further now upped in trip.

column4: Karen Codd Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mount Gay Run, 5/1 Fresh Kicks,  Buzz Iceclear, 6/1 Jakar Du Moulin, 13/2 Havefunontherun, 7/1 Dixie Mafia,  Doctor Midas, 10/1 Duel Au Soleil, 14/1 Gasmani
column36: Lightly raced 7yo and his debut for this yard in a maiden was highly encouraging
column37: Didn't last long with Paul Nicholls nor Keiran Burke, though for the latter yard he was beaten only 4.5l in a Listed novice hurdle at Sandown (2m, soft) before running quite well in a Cheltenham maiden (2m4f); another sound effort after a break on last month's stable debut at Southwell (2m, soft) and the form of that maiden has substance; should stay okay (bred to) and has to be considered for his top yard.

column4: Karen Codd Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mount Gay Run, 5/1 Fresh Kicks,  Buzz Iceclear, 6/1 Jakar Du Moulin, 13/2 Havefunontherun, 7/1 Dixie Mafia,  Doctor Midas, 10/1 Duel Au Soleil, 14/1 Gasmani
column36: Rallying second on handicap debut at Southwell and stepping up in distance here
column37: Worcester maiden winner who was having only his fourth start when a rallying second over 2m4f on handicap debut at Southwell (good to soft) and stepping up in trip here looks the right move; considered.

column4: Karen Codd Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mount Gay Run, 5/1 Fresh Kicks,  Buzz Iceclear, 6/1 Jakar Du Moulin, 13/2 Havefunontherun, 7/1 Dixie Mafia,  Doctor Midas, 10/1 Duel Au Soleil, 14/1 Gasmani
column27: Earl De Cordelles & Earl La Dariole
column36: Came up short at Southwell the last time and has another 1lb to contend with; vulnerable
column37: Back from wind surgery and in new cheekpieces (joining tongue-tie) when staying on best at Wetherby (2m5f, good) but he was effectively 10lb higher when coming up short at Southwell (3m, good to soft); might be vulnerable with another 1lb to contend with.

column4: Karen Codd Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mount Gay Run, 5/1 Fresh Kicks,  Buzz Iceclear, 6/1 Jakar Du Moulin, 13/2 Havefunontherun, 7/1 Dixie Mafia,  Doctor Midas, 10/1 Duel Au Soleil, 14/1 Gasmani
column36: Lightly raced; beaten 3.5l on handicap debut at Exeter (2m7f) after break and wind surgery
column37: Point winner who showed promise in maiden/novice hurdles and again when beaten 3.5l on handicap debut at Exeter (2m7f, good to soft) after a break and wind surgery; there's more to come no doubt.

column4: Karen Codd Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mount Gay Run, 5/1 Fresh Kicks,  Buzz Iceclear, 6/1 Jakar Du Moulin, 13/2 Havefunontherun, 7/1 Dixie Mafia,  Doctor Midas, 10/1 Duel Au Soleil, 14/1 Gasmani
column32: Racing To Profit Syndicate & G Walford
column36: 2-2 in handicaps; 10lb higher here in a stronger race but looks set for a bold bid
column37: Yorkshire raider who has found sharp improvement to win his first two handicaps, both at about 3m on soft ground; had no difficulty in defying a 5lb rise last time at Wetherby; 10lb higher here in a stronger race but looks set for a bold bid.

column4: Karen Codd Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mount Gay Run, 5/1 Fresh Kicks,  Buzz Iceclear, 6/1 Jakar Du Moulin, 13/2 Havefunontherun, 7/1 Dixie Mafia,  Doctor Midas, 10/1 Duel Au Soleil, 14/1 Gasmani
column36: Second on handicap debut at Aintree, beating all bar a Skelton-trained favourite
column37: Had plenty of racing in points, going 2-8; gave it a good go on his recent handicap debut at Aintree (3m, soft) where he beat all bar a Skelton-trained favourite; up 3lb but has races in him off this mark.

column4: Karen Codd Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mount Gay Run, 5/1 Fresh Kicks,  Buzz Iceclear, 6/1 Jakar Du Moulin, 13/2 Havefunontherun, 7/1 Dixie Mafia,  Doctor Midas, 10/1 Duel Au Soleil, 14/1 Gasmani

column4: Karen Codd Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mount Gay Run, 5/1 Fresh Kicks,  Buzz Iceclear, 6/1 Jakar Du Moulin, 13/2 Havefunontherun, 7/1 Dixie Mafia,  Doctor Midas, 10/1 Duel Au Soleil, 14/1 Gasmani
column27: S C E A De La Fontaine
column36: Second to a progressive one here last time; chance in receipt of weight off all his rivals
column37: Six defeats over hurdles include three handicaps but wasn't beaten far in the latest here (extended 3m, good to soft) behind a progressive rival; solid chance in receipt of weight off all his rivals.

column4: Howden Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bad,  Issam, 9/2 The Famous Five, 7/1 General Medrano,  Rare Edition, 8/1 Scarface, 10/1 Etalon, 12/1 Matterhorn,  Here Comes Georgie
column36: On a career-high mark, lacks a recent run and ideally wants good ground
column37: Good jumper who made it 5-9 over fences with a 5l verdict at Uttoxeter in May; the 4lb rise sees him back on a career-high mark but a greater concern would be the ground as good has always been his preference.

column4: Howden Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bad,  Issam, 9/2 The Famous Five, 7/1 General Medrano,  Rare Edition, 8/1 Scarface, 10/1 Etalon, 12/1 Matterhorn,  Here Comes Georgie
column36: Ran a good fifth at Cheltenham last time and he's a better horse going right-handed
column37: Took his time to come good in Britain but went back-to-back at Kempton earlier this year (2m4f) and won again there in October; ran a very acceptable fifth in the Paddy Power Gold Cup at Cheltenham (soft) where the hill proved too much; returning to a right-handed track has to bode well and he likes it here.

column4: Howden Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bad,  Issam, 9/2 The Famous Five, 7/1 General Medrano,  Rare Edition, 8/1 Scarface, 10/1 Etalon, 12/1 Matterhorn,  Here Comes Georgie
column36: He's a capable chaser when on song but can be inconsistent, as he showed last time
column37: Will need to run better than he did last time at Newbury but he's a capable chaser when on song (can be inconsistent) and only 1lb higher than for his second in a Class 2 at Fontwell on his penultimate start; cheekpieces are added.

column4: Howden Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bad,  Issam, 9/2 The Famous Five, 7/1 General Medrano,  Rare Edition, 8/1 Scarface, 10/1 Etalon, 12/1 Matterhorn,  Here Comes Georgie
column27: Yvon Madiot, Herve Tison & Pauline Tison
column36: An improving chaser who was good value for narrow winning margin at Wetherby last month
column37: Not the biggest but jumps well and took his form figures over fences to 121 when good value for his narrow winning margin at Wetherby last month (2m3f, soft); in deeper here and off a 5lb higher mark, but he's a likeable type who also had a good strike-rate over hurdles.

column4: Howden Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bad,  Issam, 9/2 The Famous Five, 7/1 General Medrano,  Rare Edition, 8/1 Scarface, 10/1 Etalon, 12/1 Matterhorn,  Here Comes Georgie
column36: Disappointing last run but his comeback effort here in November was encouraging
column37: Ran pretty flat at Newbury last time in a race he won by 9l the previous season; hasn't looked that well handicapped since that day but he posted an eyecatching effort here on his comeback in November (when 4lb higher) and Sean Bowen is legged up for the first time; won't mind returning to a longer trip and respected.

column4: Howden Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bad,  Issam, 9/2 The Famous Five, 7/1 General Medrano,  Rare Edition, 8/1 Scarface, 10/1 Etalon, 12/1 Matterhorn,  Here Comes Georgie
column36: Better than he showed last time but even if the blinkers work he looks high in the weights
column37: 5lb higher than when second in this last year and owes his higher mark to a heavy-ground win at Newton Abbot in the spring; runner-up in the Badger Beer on his reappearance (after wind surgery) but never threatened the winner and his Newbury run was disappointing; even if the blinkers work, he does look high in the weights.

column4: Howden Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bad,  Issam, 9/2 The Famous Five, 7/1 General Medrano,  Rare Edition, 8/1 Scarface, 10/1 Etalon, 12/1 Matterhorn,  Here Comes Georgie
column36: Below best latest but still early days as a chaser and won off 4lb higher over hurdles
column37: Bumped into a serious improver on his comeback at Kelso (2m1f, good; won on soft) but probably ran below than level when beaten 13l at Newbury three weeks ago (good to soft); still fairly early days as a chaser and won off 4lb higher over hurdles.

column4: Howden Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bad,  Issam, 9/2 The Famous Five, 7/1 General Medrano,  Rare Edition, 8/1 Scarface, 10/1 Etalon, 12/1 Matterhorn,  Here Comes Georgie
column36: Early days with this yard and narrowly failed to defy a hefty weight at Doncaster
column37: 4-13 over hurdles and 2-4 as a chaser for Patrick Neville; out of the handicap when tailed off in the Haldon Gold Cup on yard debut but then narrowly failed to defy a hefty weight at Doncaster (2m3f, good to soft); has each-way claims.

column4: Howden Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bad,  Issam, 9/2 The Famous Five, 7/1 General Medrano,  Rare Edition, 8/1 Scarface, 10/1 Etalon, 12/1 Matterhorn,  Here Comes Georgie
column36: Ran well when last seen in February; every chance off this mark if his jumping holds up
column37: It hasn't all been smooth sailing with his jumping over fences and that was again the case when going down narrowly at Newbury on final appearance in February (2m, soft); there's no doubting his ability to defy a 3lb rise and gets in here on a handy weight; likely contender for a yard that's now going well.

column4: Howden Long Walk Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Honesty Policy, 3/1 Impose Toi, 4/1 Strong Leader, 17/2 Crambo, 9/1 Potters Charm, 12/1 Jet Blue, 16/1 Colonel Mustard,  Doddiethegreat, 20/1 Altobelli,  Beauport, 33/1 Gwennie May Boy
column36: Bit to find on the figures and folded tamely on his only previous attempt at 3m
column37: Goes well at Ascot and ran respectably in the face of a stiff task when fifth in 2m3f Grade 2 event here four weeks ago, but he has another stern assignment here and he folded tamely on his only previous attempt at 3m.

column4: Howden Long Walk Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Honesty Policy, 3/1 Impose Toi, 4/1 Strong Leader, 17/2 Crambo, 9/1 Potters Charm, 12/1 Jet Blue, 16/1 Colonel Mustard,  Doddiethegreat, 20/1 Altobelli,  Beauport, 33/1 Gwennie May Boy
column36: Better known as a chaser; third 12 months ago but this race is stronger
column37: Thorough stayer, best known for his exploits over fences (respectable fourth at Cheltenham on reappearance); ran well from the front when third to Crambo in this race 12 months ago, but if anything this is a stronger contest and Sam Twiston-Davies prefers Potters Charm.

column4: Howden Long Walk Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Honesty Policy, 3/1 Impose Toi, 4/1 Strong Leader, 17/2 Crambo, 9/1 Potters Charm, 12/1 Jet Blue, 16/1 Colonel Mustard,  Doddiethegreat, 20/1 Altobelli,  Beauport, 33/1 Gwennie May Boy
column32: Mrs A Frost & P G Davies & R H Fowler
column36: Veteran; better than ever with two recent wins but this is tougher and he's unproven at 3m
column37: Reliable 10yo; has suddenly got the winning habit this term, following success in conditions race at Sligo with another in Grade 2 at Navan (2m4f, soft to heavy; gamely); however, this is tougher and he's unproven at 3m.

column4: Howden Long Walk Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Honesty Policy, 3/1 Impose Toi, 4/1 Strong Leader, 17/2 Crambo, 9/1 Potters Charm, 12/1 Jet Blue, 16/1 Colonel Mustard,  Doddiethegreat, 20/1 Altobelli,  Beauport, 33/1 Gwennie May Boy
column36: Won this race in 2023 and 2024 but has become inconsistent and others look much safer
column37: Bidding for a hat-trick of Long Walk Hurdles but has become inconsistent and found little when tailed off over 2m3f here four weeks ago; stepping back up in distance should be a big help and he's impossible to discount, but others look much safer.

column4: Howden Long Walk Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Honesty Policy, 3/1 Impose Toi, 4/1 Strong Leader, 17/2 Crambo, 9/1 Potters Charm, 12/1 Jet Blue, 16/1 Colonel Mustard,  Doddiethegreat, 20/1 Altobelli,  Beauport, 33/1 Gwennie May Boy
column36: Good efforts in Grade 2 events this autumn; likely to give running again but needs more
column37: Last season's Pertemps Final winner (3m, good to soft); good efforts in Grade 2 events at Wetherby and Newbury this autumn, 6l fourth to Impose Toi in latter; likely to give his running again but needs more.

column4: Howden Long Walk Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Honesty Policy, 3/1 Impose Toi, 4/1 Strong Leader, 17/2 Crambo, 9/1 Potters Charm, 12/1 Jet Blue, 16/1 Colonel Mustard,  Doddiethegreat, 20/1 Altobelli,  Beauport, 33/1 Gwennie May Boy
column36: Showed little at 80-1 on reappearance/stable debut and has plenty to prove
column37: Four wins at 2m7f/3m for Dan Skelton, including Grade 2 event, but he showed little at 80-1 on reappearance/stable debut here (2m3f) last month; returning to this trip is a positive but he still has plenty to prove.

column4: Howden Long Walk Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Honesty Policy, 3/1 Impose Toi, 4/1 Strong Leader, 17/2 Crambo, 9/1 Potters Charm, 12/1 Jet Blue, 16/1 Colonel Mustard,  Doddiethegreat, 20/1 Altobelli,  Beauport, 33/1 Gwennie May Boy
column27: H Fowler, A Frost & C Longsdon
column36: Lightly raced and progressive; winner and runner-up in Grade 1 novices; high on the list
column37: Lightly raced and progressive; took the rise in class in his stride when winning Grade 1 novice at Aintree (2m4f, good) in April, and he was a very good second when stepped up in distance for similar event at Punchestown (3m, yielding) later that month; still has untapped potential and he's high on the list after eight months off.

column4: Howden Long Walk Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Honesty Policy, 3/1 Impose Toi, 4/1 Strong Leader, 17/2 Crambo, 9/1 Potters Charm, 12/1 Jet Blue, 16/1 Colonel Mustard,  Doddiethegreat, 20/1 Altobelli,  Beauport, 33/1 Gwennie May Boy
column36: Improving 7yo; beat Strong Leader in Grade 2 and may not have reached his limit just yet
column37: Upwardly mobile 7yo with a fine strike-rate; has taken his form to a higher level this term, winning handicap at Aintree and Grade 2 Long Distance Hurdle at Newbury (3m, soft; beat Strong Leader in tight finish); 6lb worse off with Strong Leader today but he may not have reached his limit just yet.

column4: Howden Long Walk Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Honesty Policy, 3/1 Impose Toi, 4/1 Strong Leader, 17/2 Crambo, 9/1 Potters Charm, 12/1 Jet Blue, 16/1 Colonel Mustard,  Doddiethegreat, 20/1 Altobelli,  Beauport, 33/1 Gwennie May Boy
column36: Good second in Grade 1 event at Auteuil but that still leaves him with an uphill task
column37: French-trained 6yo; won a 3m Grade 2 novice hurdle at Cheltenham last winter and posted a career best when chasing home a classy type in Grade 1 event at Auteuil (3m, heavy) five weeks ago; however, that still leaves him with an uphill task on the figures.

column4: Howden Long Walk Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Honesty Policy, 3/1 Impose Toi, 4/1 Strong Leader, 17/2 Crambo, 9/1 Potters Charm, 12/1 Jet Blue, 16/1 Colonel Mustard,  Doddiethegreat, 20/1 Altobelli,  Beauport, 33/1 Gwennie May Boy
column36: Third in 2m3f Grade 2 on this course last time; unexposed over 3m+; might be the answer
column37: Smart novice (Grade 1 winner) at up to 2m5f last term and he ran well when third in 2m3f Grade 2 here four weeks ago; has a bit to find on ratings with some of these but he's still unexposed, especially over 3m+, and his pedigree gives hope that he'll improve for the trip; might be the answer.

column4: Howden Long Walk Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Honesty Policy, 3/1 Impose Toi, 4/1 Strong Leader, 17/2 Crambo, 9/1 Potters Charm, 12/1 Jet Blue, 16/1 Colonel Mustard,  Doddiethegreat, 20/1 Altobelli,  Beauport, 33/1 Gwennie May Boy
column36: Close second to Impose Toi last month and now better off at the weights; solid contender
column37: Solid contender who went down narrowly to Impose Toi in Grade 2 at Newbury (3m, soft) last month and meets that rival on 6lb better terms; ran poorly when favourite for this race 12 months ago but otherwise he has plenty in his favour.

column4: Howden Silver Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Blow Your Wad, 5/1 Victtorino,  Pic Roc, 6/1 Johnnywho, 8/1 Henry's Friend, 10/1 Hyland,  Deep Cave, 12/1 Threeunderthrufive,  Transmission, 14/1 Leave Of Absence, 25/1 Ga Law, 33/1 Two For Gold
column36: Approaching two years since his last win but he's classy on his day and they claim 7lb
column37: Approaching two years since his last win and he has mistakes in him; however, he ran surprisingly well when third to Gaelic Warrior in a Grade 2 at Sandown (2m6f, good) in April and he might well come on for his comeback effort in the Charlie Hall; with Isabelle Ryder good value for the 7lb claim he's not entirely ruled out.

column4: Howden Silver Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Blow Your Wad, 5/1 Victtorino,  Pic Roc, 6/1 Johnnywho, 8/1 Henry's Friend, 10/1 Hyland,  Deep Cave, 12/1 Threeunderthrufive,  Transmission, 14/1 Leave Of Absence, 25/1 Ga Law, 33/1 Two For Gold
column36: Now has a bit to prove, for all that returning here has to rate a positive
column37: C&D winner who was third behind Victtorino in this last year and pushed that same horse to a nose back here in February, after which he was pulled up in the Grand National and Sandown's big chase in April; nor did he run much of a race in last month's Badger Beer (after another wind op) and now has a bit to prove, for all that returning here has to rate a positive.

column4: Howden Silver Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Blow Your Wad, 5/1 Victtorino,  Pic Roc, 6/1 Johnnywho, 8/1 Henry's Friend, 10/1 Hyland,  Deep Cave, 12/1 Threeunderthrufive,  Transmission, 14/1 Leave Of Absence, 25/1 Ga Law, 33/1 Two For Gold
column36: 2-2 here and has never shone at Cheltenham, so can be forgiven last week's run there
column37: Strong form when fending off respected opposition over C&D (good; fine on softer) in early November (when 3lb lower) and it wasn't his first no show at Cheltenham when tailed off there last week; better expected back here.

column4: Howden Silver Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Blow Your Wad, 5/1 Victtorino,  Pic Roc, 6/1 Johnnywho, 8/1 Henry's Friend, 10/1 Hyland,  Deep Cave, 12/1 Threeunderthrufive,  Transmission, 14/1 Leave Of Absence, 25/1 Ga Law, 33/1 Two For Gold
column36: Four wins from five visits to Ascot include the last two editions of this race
column37: Goes on any ground; four wins from five visits to Ascot include the last two editions of this race; finished third in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury last season prior to arriving here, whereas he never figured in that race 21 days ago; still commands the utmost respect back here off what's a competitive mark.

column4: Howden Silver Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Blow Your Wad, 5/1 Victtorino,  Pic Roc, 6/1 Johnnywho, 8/1 Henry's Friend, 10/1 Hyland,  Deep Cave, 12/1 Threeunderthrufive,  Transmission, 14/1 Leave Of Absence, 25/1 Ga Law, 33/1 Two For Gold
column27: Jean-Pierre Dubois & Scea Haras Du Ma
column36: Prominent racer who usually jumps well; reportedly unsuited by soft ground last time
column37: It was his first real blip over fences when reportedly unsuited by the soft ground in a Listed novice chase at Cheltenham last time; conditions might be a concern once more and the handicapper hit him hard for his two previous wins; prominent racer who usually jumps well.

column4: Howden Silver Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Blow Your Wad, 5/1 Victtorino,  Pic Roc, 6/1 Johnnywho, 8/1 Henry's Friend, 10/1 Hyland,  Deep Cave, 12/1 Threeunderthrufive,  Transmission, 14/1 Leave Of Absence, 25/1 Ga Law, 33/1 Two For Gold
column32: May We Never Be Found Out Partnership 2
column36: Well held behind Henry's Friend here last month and he turns 13 very soon
column37: Has run plenty of good races at this track, though not in this 12 months ago when pulled up; also well held behind Henry's Friend here last month and he turns 13 very soon; looks vulnerable.

column4: Howden Silver Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Blow Your Wad, 5/1 Victtorino,  Pic Roc, 6/1 Johnnywho, 8/1 Henry's Friend, 10/1 Hyland,  Deep Cave, 12/1 Threeunderthrufive,  Transmission, 14/1 Leave Of Absence, 25/1 Ga Law, 33/1 Two For Gold
column36: Remains a chaser of interest and entitled to step up on his good return at Aintree.
column37: Went down by a neck in last season's Kim Muir at Cheltenham (3m2f, good to soft) after travelling much the best and then didn't appear to stay 3m5f in the Irish National; remains a chaser of interest and smacked of one who would come on for the race when beaten only 8l in the Grand Sefton at Aintree (2m5f); on the shortlist over what could be his optimum trip.

column4: Howden Silver Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Blow Your Wad, 5/1 Victtorino,  Pic Roc, 6/1 Johnnywho, 8/1 Henry's Friend, 10/1 Hyland,  Deep Cave, 12/1 Threeunderthrufive,  Transmission, 14/1 Leave Of Absence, 25/1 Ga Law, 33/1 Two For Gold
column36: Last season was positive and ran well for a long way in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury
column37: Good or good to soft seems ideal; remains on a realistic mark despite enjoying such a productive novice campaign last season and he ran well for a long way in the Coral Gold Cup three weeks ago; held back by his jumping on occasions but has a big run in him.

column4: Howden Silver Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Blow Your Wad, 5/1 Victtorino,  Pic Roc, 6/1 Johnnywho, 8/1 Henry's Friend, 10/1 Hyland,  Deep Cave, 12/1 Threeunderthrufive,  Transmission, 14/1 Leave Of Absence, 25/1 Ga Law, 33/1 Two For Gold
column36: Excellent third over C&D last month but hasn't always followed one good run with another
column37: A lot of his chase form is at 2m4f but he was a big market mover when upped to this trip here last month and he saw it out fine to be a close third on his first run back from a second wind operation (first-time visor); the return of cheekpieces is no negative but he hasn't always followed one good run with another.

column4: Howden Silver Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Blow Your Wad, 5/1 Victtorino,  Pic Roc, 6/1 Johnnywho, 8/1 Henry's Friend, 10/1 Hyland,  Deep Cave, 12/1 Threeunderthrufive,  Transmission, 14/1 Leave Of Absence, 25/1 Ga Law, 33/1 Two For Gold
column36: Did it nicely back over fences at Bangor and still well treated off 4lb higher
column37: Won a big-field 3m handicap hurdle at last season's Grand National meeting and was having only his fourth run over fences when doing it nicely at Bangor (3m, soft) last month; still looks well treated off only 4lb higher and he's got time on his side to keep progressing.

column4: Howden Silver Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Blow Your Wad, 5/1 Victtorino,  Pic Roc, 6/1 Johnnywho, 8/1 Henry's Friend, 10/1 Hyland,  Deep Cave, 12/1 Threeunderthrufive,  Transmission, 14/1 Leave Of Absence, 25/1 Ga Law, 33/1 Two For Gold
column36: Backed for the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury but lost his chance at the start
column37: Patchy profile over fences (1-9) but easily dominated a small-field non-handicap at Huntingdon last month; was one of the big market movers in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury but lost all chance when behind early after a standing start; didn't do at all badly to finish fifth and he could still be open to improvement; might be better handicapped than some in here.

column4: Howden Silver Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Blow Your Wad, 5/1 Victtorino,  Pic Roc, 6/1 Johnnywho, 8/1 Henry's Friend, 10/1 Hyland,  Deep Cave, 12/1 Threeunderthrufive,  Transmission, 14/1 Leave Of Absence, 25/1 Ga Law, 33/1 Two For Gold
column36: Nowhere near his best this season but he'll probably turn a corner at some point
column37: Has been a Cheltenham regular over fences and was competitive off this sort of mark there last season; that's not been the case this campaign but he should turn a corner at some point.

column4: Ascot Rotary Club Festive Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Mondo Man, 9/2 Alexei, 11/2 Wilful, 8/1 Fiercely Proud, 9/1 Helnwein, 14/1 Live Conti,  Sticktotheplan,  Faivoir,  Wreckless Eric, 16/1 Joyeuse, 25/1 Welsh Charger, 28/1 Hardy Du Seuil, 33/1 Hot Fuss
column36: Improving quickly, winning here and at Cheltenham last two starts; high on the list
column37: Upwardly mobile 5yo who followed a C&D win (good ground) with a convincing success in the Greatwood at Cheltenham (soft) two weeks later; improving at a rate of knots and high on the list despite a 13lb rise in the weights from Cheltenham.

column4: Ascot Rotary Club Festive Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Mondo Man, 9/2 Alexei, 11/2 Wilful, 8/1 Fiercely Proud, 9/1 Helnwein, 14/1 Live Conti,  Sticktotheplan,  Faivoir,  Wreckless Eric, 16/1 Joyeuse, 25/1 Welsh Charger, 28/1 Hardy Du Seuil, 33/1 Hot Fuss
column36: Lightly raced 4yo; runner-up in Aintree Grade 1 novice; reappears with stacks of potential
column37: Lightly raced 4yo; won at Wetherby (2m, soft) last winter on first outing for new connections and ran a cracker when 6l second of 13 in Grade 1 event at Aintree (2m1f, good to soft) in April; will need another personal best to make a successful handicap debut after over eight months off but he has stacks of potential and it's certainly possible.

column4: Ascot Rotary Club Festive Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Mondo Man, 9/2 Alexei, 11/2 Wilful, 8/1 Fiercely Proud, 9/1 Helnwein, 14/1 Live Conti,  Sticktotheplan,  Faivoir,  Wreckless Eric, 16/1 Joyeuse, 25/1 Welsh Charger, 28/1 Hardy Du Seuil, 33/1 Hot Fuss
column27: E A R L Haras Du Lieu Des Champs
column36: Grade 2 novice winner and better than result suggests last time; not dismissed lightly
column37: Best effort when winning Grade 2 Persian War Novices' Hurdle at Chepstow (2m3f, good; hooded) in October with smart turn of foot; ended up with too much to do when third in similar event at Haydock (1m7f, good to soft) next time; tackles a handicap for the first time and not dismissed lightly.

column4: Ascot Rotary Club Festive Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Mondo Man, 9/2 Alexei, 11/2 Wilful, 8/1 Fiercely Proud, 9/1 Helnwein, 14/1 Live Conti,  Sticktotheplan,  Faivoir,  Wreckless Eric, 16/1 Joyeuse, 25/1 Welsh Charger, 28/1 Hardy Du Seuil, 33/1 Hot Fuss
column36: Beaten favourite in two chases this season; will need career best back over hurdles
column37: Impressive winner of major handicap at Newbury (2m, soft) last February; beaten favourite in two runs over fences this season, making the odd mistake; no surprise to see her back over hurdles but she'll need a career best off a 17lb higher mark than at Newbury.

column4: Ascot Rotary Club Festive Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Mondo Man, 9/2 Alexei, 11/2 Wilful, 8/1 Fiercely Proud, 9/1 Helnwein, 14/1 Live Conti,  Sticktotheplan,  Faivoir,  Wreckless Eric, 16/1 Joyeuse, 25/1 Welsh Charger, 28/1 Hardy Du Seuil, 33/1 Hot Fuss
column36: Pleasing return from break when third at Chepstow; should be in the thick of things again
column37: 4-10 over hurdles and made a pleasing return from over five months off when third of nine at Chepstow (2m, good) in October; reliable and likely to be in the thick of things again.

column4: Ascot Rotary Club Festive Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Mondo Man, 9/2 Alexei, 11/2 Wilful, 8/1 Fiercely Proud, 9/1 Helnwein, 14/1 Live Conti,  Sticktotheplan,  Faivoir,  Wreckless Eric, 16/1 Joyeuse, 25/1 Welsh Charger, 28/1 Hardy Du Seuil, 33/1 Hot Fuss
column36: Won this 12 months ago and shaped nicely on reappearance; interesting contender
column37: Won this race last year on good to soft ground off 7lb lower; disappointing in warm races on his next two starts but he shaped much better when fifth of 18 to Alexei in the Greatwood at Cheltenham on reappearance; may well come on for that run and he's an interesting contender back at Ascot.

column4: Ascot Rotary Club Festive Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Mondo Man, 9/2 Alexei, 11/2 Wilful, 8/1 Fiercely Proud, 9/1 Helnwein, 14/1 Live Conti,  Sticktotheplan,  Faivoir,  Wreckless Eric, 16/1 Joyeuse, 25/1 Welsh Charger, 28/1 Hardy Du Seuil, 33/1 Hot Fuss
column27: E A R L Trinquet & M & O Trinquet
column36: Veteran; third to Alexei in the Greatwood at Cheltenham; others appeal more for the win
column37: Veteran but retains plenty of ability and he stepped up a good deal on his reappearance run when third to Alexei in the Greatwood at Cheltenham five weeks ago; Heidi Palin keeps the ride; could make the frame again but others appeal more for the win.

column4: Ascot Rotary Club Festive Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Mondo Man, 9/2 Alexei, 11/2 Wilful, 8/1 Fiercely Proud, 9/1 Helnwein, 14/1 Live Conti,  Sticktotheplan,  Faivoir,  Wreckless Eric, 16/1 Joyeuse, 25/1 Welsh Charger, 28/1 Hardy Du Seuil, 33/1 Hot Fuss
column36: Chased home clearcut winner Alexei in the Greatwood; obvious each-way claims again
column37: Has plenty of solid form in big fields and chased home clearcut winner Alexei in the Greatwood at Cheltenham (2m, soft; 14-1) last month; 9lb better off with the winner and has obvious each-way claims again.

column4: Ascot Rotary Club Festive Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Mondo Man, 9/2 Alexei, 11/2 Wilful, 8/1 Fiercely Proud, 9/1 Helnwein, 14/1 Live Conti,  Sticktotheplan,  Faivoir,  Wreckless Eric, 16/1 Joyeuse, 25/1 Welsh Charger, 28/1 Hardy Du Seuil, 33/1 Hot Fuss
column36: Fourth to Alexei in the Greatwood was a respectable effort but others have more potential
column37: Yet another in this field to finish behind Alexei in the Greatwood last time, in his case rallying into fourth after making the running; he wasn't beaten far in the Scottish Champion Hurdle in the spring but others have more potential.

column4: Ascot Rotary Club Festive Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Mondo Man, 9/2 Alexei, 11/2 Wilful, 8/1 Fiercely Proud, 9/1 Helnwein, 14/1 Live Conti,  Sticktotheplan,  Faivoir,  Wreckless Eric, 16/1 Joyeuse, 25/1 Welsh Charger, 28/1 Hardy Du Seuil, 33/1 Hot Fuss
column36: Unlucky second in the Imperial Cup and had an excuse next time; well worth considering
column37: Might have won the Imperial Cup at Sandown (2m, good to soft) in March but for bungling the final flight, and he possibly failed to stay 2m4f at Aintree next time; still has untapped potential and he's well worth considering on his reappearance off just a 2lb higher mark than at Sandown.

column4: Ascot Rotary Club Festive Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Mondo Man, 9/2 Alexei, 11/2 Wilful, 8/1 Fiercely Proud, 9/1 Helnwein, 14/1 Live Conti,  Sticktotheplan,  Faivoir,  Wreckless Eric, 16/1 Joyeuse, 25/1 Welsh Charger, 28/1 Hardy Du Seuil, 33/1 Hot Fuss
column36: Ended losing run at Windsor last month; back up 5lb and faces much stronger opposition
column37: Ended a losing sequence at Windsor (2m, good to soft) last month when well handled by 7lb claimer Isabelle Ryder, but he's gone back up 5lb and faces much stronger opposition here.

column4: Ascot Rotary Club Festive Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Mondo Man, 9/2 Alexei, 11/2 Wilful, 8/1 Fiercely Proud, 9/1 Helnwein, 14/1 Live Conti,  Sticktotheplan,  Faivoir,  Wreckless Eric, 16/1 Joyeuse, 25/1 Welsh Charger, 28/1 Hardy Du Seuil, 33/1 Hot Fuss
column36: Useful Flat racer; 0-4 over hurdles but looks well treated for handicap debut; big player
column37: Useful Flat racer; 0-4 over hurdles but he was highly tried last season and bumped into a promising type when second in novice at Lingfield (2m, good to soft) on reappearance, the pair pulling well clear; does not look overburdened on handicap debut and he commands major respect.

column4: Ascot Rotary Club Festive Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Mondo Man, 9/2 Alexei, 11/2 Wilful, 8/1 Fiercely Proud, 9/1 Helnwein, 14/1 Live Conti,  Sticktotheplan,  Faivoir,  Wreckless Eric, 16/1 Joyeuse, 25/1 Welsh Charger, 28/1 Hardy Du Seuil, 33/1 Hot Fuss
column36: Fourth at Cheltenham Festival but not at best in three runs since; enough to prove
column37: Ended first hurdles campaign with good fourth in the Fred Winter at Cheltenham (2m, good to soft); however, not at his best in three runs since, well held back over hurdles at Newbury three weeks ago; more to prove than most.

column4: Betfred Nifty 50 Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
column20: 9/4 Le Yacht, 3/1 Super Freddie, 7/1 Haarar,  Pounds At The Time, 9/1 El Jefe, 10/1 Brucio,  North Parade, 14/1 A Different Kind, 25/1 Achnamara
column27: G Durrheim And Maria Mulcahy Durrheim
column36: Smart at best but more recent efforts leave him with lots to prove; tongue-tie added
column37: Three-time hurdle winner who won four handicap chases in a row in July-September 2023 (2m5f/2m5f, heavy-good); this 8yo is very well handicapped on that form but he's struggled in recent starts, including on return from 17 months off (had wind surgery) at Carlisle three weeks ago; plenty to prove with a tongue-tie added now.

column4: Betfred Nifty 50 Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
column20: 9/4 Le Yacht, 3/1 Super Freddie, 7/1 Haarar,  Pounds At The Time, 9/1 El Jefe, 10/1 Brucio,  North Parade, 14/1 A Different Kind, 25/1 Achnamara
column36: Made it 2-3 over hurdles with Doncaster handicap win (soft) latest; should be more to come
column37: Made it 2-3 over hurdles (both wins around 2m on soft) when accounting for six rivals on Doncaster handicap debut three weeks ago; raised 5lb but there should be more to come, particularly now moving up in trip.

column4: Betfred Nifty 50 Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
column20: 9/4 Le Yacht, 3/1 Super Freddie, 7/1 Haarar,  Pounds At The Time, 9/1 El Jefe, 10/1 Brucio,  North Parade, 14/1 A Different Kind, 25/1 Achnamara
column36: Has struggled since chasing and needs return to hurdles to spark revival; cheekpieces on
column37: Useful hurdler at her best when based in Ireland but ended last season with two unconvincing chase runs and soundly beaten in two more starts over fences for her new yard this autumn; needs a return to hurdles and first-time cheekpieces (which are added to regular tongue-tie) to help spark a revival.

column4: Betfred Nifty 50 Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
column20: 9/4 Le Yacht, 3/1 Super Freddie, 7/1 Haarar,  Pounds At The Time, 9/1 El Jefe, 10/1 Brucio,  North Parade, 14/1 A Different Kind, 25/1 Achnamara
column36: Deep ground an unknown but he's a potential improver making quick switch to handicaps
column37: Bettered last season's low-key bumper debut when placed in 2m novice/maiden hurdles at Bangor and Ludlow (both good) in recent months; today's much softer ground is an unknown but he's a potential improver making a quick switch to handicaps.

column4: Betfred Nifty 50 Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
column20: 9/4 Le Yacht, 3/1 Super Freddie, 7/1 Haarar,  Pounds At The Time, 9/1 El Jefe, 10/1 Brucio,  North Parade, 14/1 A Different Kind, 25/1 Achnamara
column36: Two wins last winter but failed to shine subsequently; fell back from break last week
column37: Two wins last winter (2m4f/2m3f, good to soft) but failed to shine subsequently (Flat/hurdles) and fell around halfway when sent off at 50-1 back from a break at Newcastle last week.

column4: Betfred Nifty 50 Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
column20: 9/4 Le Yacht, 3/1 Super Freddie, 7/1 Haarar,  Pounds At The Time, 9/1 El Jefe, 10/1 Brucio,  North Parade, 14/1 A Different Kind, 25/1 Achnamara
column36: Well treated but not enough in two efforts starts this season to fancy him strongly
column37: Completed a Newcastle hat-trick (2m4f; good-heavy) in 2023-24 season; inconsistency crept in last campaign and he's failed to make a significant impact in his two outings this term; the yard's continued good form makes him a dangerous one to discount but others arrive with more pressing claims.

column4: Betfred Nifty 50 Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
column20: 9/4 Le Yacht, 3/1 Super Freddie, 7/1 Haarar,  Pounds At The Time, 9/1 El Jefe, 10/1 Brucio,  North Parade, 14/1 A Different Kind, 25/1 Achnamara
column36: Largely consistent but was a little below par when well-held third over C&D latest
column37: Largely consistent over hurdles (including three wins) but he didn't build as expected on his Aintree reappearance second when beaten over 18l into third over C&D (good to soft) 17 days ago.

column4: Betfred Nifty 50 Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
column20: 9/4 Le Yacht, 3/1 Super Freddie, 7/1 Haarar,  Pounds At The Time, 9/1 El Jefe, 10/1 Brucio,  North Parade, 14/1 A Different Kind, 25/1 Achnamara
column36: Decent bumper form; looks interesting on handicap debut
column37: Split useful rivals in a Tramore bumper on soft/heavy last November; hasn't threatened when reaching the frame in maiden/novice hurdles for new yard this autumn but the way he stayed on for fourth over 2m at Chepstow (soft) latterly suggests improvement could be forthcoming now stepping back up in trip for his handicap debut.

column4: Betfred Nifty 50 Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
column20: 9/4 Le Yacht, 3/1 Super Freddie, 7/1 Haarar,  Pounds At The Time, 9/1 El Jefe, 10/1 Brucio,  North Parade, 14/1 A Different Kind, 25/1 Achnamara
column36: Won this race two years ago; no win since spring 2024 but reappearance quite encouraging
column37: Won this race on heavy ground two years ago; has drawn a blank since springing a 40-1 surprise at Aintree in April 2024 but he's come down in the weights as a result and reappearance third of 11 over an extended 2m4f at Ayr shows he retains the ability to make an impact from his reduced mark.

column4: Betfred "Bet Builder" "Chasing Excellence" Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 8/15 Bill Joyce, 9/2 Ayiko, 5/1 Lario, 10/1 Largy Belter
column36: Quite a useful hurdler at up to 3m; unseated on reappearance; down in trip for chase debut
column37: Bumper and maiden hurdle winner on soft ground at Ayr; ended last season with a good third in valuable 2m7f Fairyhouse novice handicap hurdle in April; looked to be going okay when unseating six out in 3m1f Navan handicap hurdle on reappearance but it was too far out to predict anything; drops back in trip for chase debut.

column4: Betfred "Bet Builder" "Chasing Excellence" Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 8/15 Bill Joyce, 9/2 Ayiko, 5/1 Lario, 10/1 Largy Belter
column36: Smart novice hurdler last season; point winner who should take to chasing; the one to beat
column37: Smart novice hurdler around 2m4f last season, including a Grade 2 win at Sandown (soft) and third in Grade 1 Challow at Newbury (good to soft); disappointed in 2m7f Punchestown handicap hurdle on his final start but this point winner appeals as one who can get his career back on track now chasing.

column4: Betfred "Bet Builder" "Chasing Excellence" Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 8/15 Bill Joyce, 9/2 Ayiko, 5/1 Lario, 10/1 Largy Belter
column36: Second in Irish bumper but tailed off both chase starts for this yard
column37: Second in an Irish bumper but tailed off in his two chase runs for this yard; they were good races but he can still only be watched here.

column4: Betfred "Bet Builder" "Chasing Excellence" Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 8/15 Bill Joyce, 9/2 Ayiko, 5/1 Lario, 10/1 Largy Belter
column36: Fairly useful and consistent 2m hurdler; acts on soft; chase debut after 253 days off
column37: Quite a useful 2m hurdler who has some good form on soft ground; off 253 days ahead of this chase debut.

column4: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Cobbler's Boy, 7/2 Joltin N Jiving, 4/1 Saligo Bay, 8/1 Milldam,  King Ulanda, 9/1 Irish Blaze, 10/1 Ip Up, 16/1 How About No, 25/1 No Ordinary Joe
column36: Smart at best but struggled in four runs for Faye Bramley; could only consider if backed
column37: Smart hurdler at his best but hasn't got close to that level in four outings for Faye Bramley, including down the field at Cheltenham only eight days ago; best watched unless the betting hints that a revival is anticipated.

column4: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Cobbler's Boy, 7/2 Joltin N Jiving, 4/1 Saligo Bay, 8/1 Milldam,  King Ulanda, 9/1 Irish Blaze, 10/1 Ip Up, 16/1 How About No, 25/1 No Ordinary Joe
column36: Won this on heavy last year but needs to shrug off disappointing C&D reappearance
column37: Made all in this race on heavy ground 12 months ago; not disgraced in the Morebattle at Kelso on only subsequent start last season but made a very disappointing return to action here on Betfair Chase day, particularly given the yard's excellent form in general at that time.

column4: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Cobbler's Boy, 7/2 Joltin N Jiving, 4/1 Saligo Bay, 8/1 Milldam,  King Ulanda, 9/1 Irish Blaze, 10/1 Ip Up, 16/1 How About No, 25/1 No Ordinary Joe
column36: Largely progressive, including second on 2m handicap debut and reappearance; respected
column37: Point winner who got off the mark over hurdles at Carlisle (2m1f, good to soft) in February; no impact in Aintree Grade 1 novice in the spring but back on the up when second on 2m Kelso handicap debut and reappearance on soft; an unexposed profile provides hope that he can build on that.

column4: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Cobbler's Boy, 7/2 Joltin N Jiving, 4/1 Saligo Bay, 8/1 Milldam,  King Ulanda, 9/1 Irish Blaze, 10/1 Ip Up, 16/1 How About No, 25/1 No Ordinary Joe
column36: Made all in 2m Warwick maiden in May; likely improver in handicaps for top yard
column37: Came good after wind surgery (also tongue tied first time) when making all in 2m Warwick maiden hurdle (good) in May; faces much softer ground now handicapping on his return but he was second in an Irish point on soft/heavy; likely improver who has to enter the reckoning, particularly if the market vibes are strong.

column4: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Cobbler's Boy, 7/2 Joltin N Jiving, 4/1 Saligo Bay, 8/1 Milldam,  King Ulanda, 9/1 Irish Blaze, 10/1 Ip Up, 16/1 How About No, 25/1 No Ordinary Joe
column36: In rude health this autumn, winning on Flat and three times over hurdles; respected
column37: In rude health this autumn, scoring on the Flat at Chester before adding handicap hurdle wins around 2m at Market Rasen and Wetherby (twice); up to a career-high mark but for good reason.

column4: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Cobbler's Boy, 7/2 Joltin N Jiving, 4/1 Saligo Bay, 8/1 Milldam,  King Ulanda, 9/1 Irish Blaze, 10/1 Ip Up, 16/1 How About No, 25/1 No Ordinary Joe
column36: Fair fifth on Carlisle handicap debut/return but underlines his mark demands improvement
column37: Sixth attempt over hurdles when winning a five-runner novice at Catterick (near 2m, soft) on New Year's Day on second run for this yard; made a sound return to action when fifth (Ip Up fourth) of 13 in 2m1f Carlisle handicap (soft) seven weeks ago but that does underline that his mark demands improvement.

column4: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Cobbler's Boy, 7/2 Joltin N Jiving, 4/1 Saligo Bay, 8/1 Milldam,  King Ulanda, 9/1 Irish Blaze, 10/1 Ip Up, 16/1 How About No, 25/1 No Ordinary Joe
column36: Useful at peak in Ireland needs betting check for yard doing well with new recruits
column37: Useful hurdler/chaser at his peak in Ireland; ended his time over there on a low note when pulled up at Tramore on New Year's Day but interesting on his return for an in-form stable which has been doing particularly well with new recruits; market support would increase confidence.

column4: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Cobbler's Boy, 7/2 Joltin N Jiving, 4/1 Saligo Bay, 8/1 Milldam,  King Ulanda, 9/1 Irish Blaze, 10/1 Ip Up, 16/1 How About No, 25/1 No Ordinary Joe
column36: Ready win at Carlisle in October but beaten twice since; needs to resume progression
column37: First run after a wind operation when winning by 11l at Carlisle (2m1f, good) in October; bumped into one at Worcester next time but there were no apparent excuses when only a respectable fourth at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft) four weeks ago; needs to resume his improvement.

column4: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Cobbler's Boy, 7/2 Joltin N Jiving, 4/1 Saligo Bay, 8/1 Milldam,  King Ulanda, 9/1 Irish Blaze, 10/1 Ip Up, 16/1 How About No, 25/1 No Ordinary Joe
column36: Has run well to reach frame both starts this season but needs to pull more to win here
column37: 3-17 over hurdles; has given a good account when reaching the frame in soft-ground handicaps at Carlisle and Leicester this season but will need to pull out a bit more to resume winning ways now.

column4: Betfred Hat Trick Heaven Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Escapeandevade, 5/1 Cabhfuilfungi,  Pony Soprano, 6/1 Sunnyvilla, 13/2 My Noble Lord, 15/2 Primoz, 9/1 Master Breffni, 14/1 Netywell
column36: Went close on reappearance; hasn't kicked on but he's not ruled out off a handy mark
column37: Two wins last season (good to soft/soft) and he went close at Kelso (2m1f, good) in September on his reappearance; hasn't kicked on from that comeback run on his two starts since but he's not ruled out off a handy mark.

column4: Betfred Hat Trick Heaven Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Escapeandevade, 5/1 Cabhfuilfungi,  Pony Soprano, 6/1 Sunnyvilla, 13/2 My Noble Lord, 15/2 Primoz, 9/1 Master Breffni, 14/1 Netywell
column36: Runner-up on both starts for this yard; heading back up the weights but high on the list
column37: Runner-up on stable debut at Worcester (2m, good) in October and filled same position over this C&D (good to soft) last month, when clear with David's Well who followed up at Cheltenham; has won on soft and heavy ground; heading back up the weights but high on the list given the form he's in.

column4: Betfred Hat Trick Heaven Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Escapeandevade, 5/1 Cabhfuilfungi,  Pony Soprano, 6/1 Sunnyvilla, 13/2 My Noble Lord, 15/2 Primoz, 9/1 Master Breffni, 14/1 Netywell
column36: Consistent last season and not beaten far on his reappearance, which he could improve for
column37: 9yo who was consistent when switched to fences last season and he was beaten only 5l when fifth of 11 on last month's reappearance at Cheltenham (2m, soft); could improve for that outing and he's a possible player.

column4: Betfred Hat Trick Heaven Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Escapeandevade, 5/1 Cabhfuilfungi,  Pony Soprano, 6/1 Sunnyvilla, 13/2 My Noble Lord, 15/2 Primoz, 9/1 Master Breffni, 14/1 Netywell
column27: Mme Clarence Signol & Mr Xavier Brelaud
column36: Won this two years ago; well treated but hasn't been at the top of his game this season
column37: Won three in a row in winter 2023-24, including this race on heavy ground, and well treated on last season's best; however, not at the top of his game on first two outings this autumn and he fell mid-race here last time.

column4: Betfred Hat Trick Heaven Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Escapeandevade, 5/1 Cabhfuilfungi,  Pony Soprano, 6/1 Sunnyvilla, 13/2 My Noble Lord, 15/2 Primoz, 9/1 Master Breffni, 14/1 Netywell
column36: In and out since winning on hurdle debut last October but not written off for top yard
column37: Won on hurdle debut at Exeter (2m2f, good to soft) last October and tapped back into that promise when third of five on chase debut at Worcester (2m4f, good) this October; disappointing in handicap at Exeter (2m3f, good to soft) since but made a bad mistake mid-race and is not written off.

column4: Betfred Hat Trick Heaven Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Escapeandevade, 5/1 Cabhfuilfungi,  Pony Soprano, 6/1 Sunnyvilla, 13/2 My Noble Lord, 15/2 Primoz, 9/1 Master Breffni, 14/1 Netywell
column36: Won this last year and he could improve for last month's reappearance fourth over C&D
column37: 10yo who made winning stable debut in this race 12 months ago (heavy); didn't jump well when second at Ayr (2m, good to soft) next time; 19l behind runner-up Escapeandevade when fourth over C&D (good to soft) on last month's reappearance but he could improve for that run and might be involved.

column4: Betfred Hat Trick Heaven Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

column4: Horse & Jockey Hotel Rated Novice Hurdle

column37: E54,000 3yo; 11th foal; Harzand filly is a sister to bumper/ hurdle winner Zanoosh, half-sister to five winners including Paiardina (Italian, Listed Flat), smart nine-time jumps winners Brave Eagle, and Nucky Johnson (bumper/hurdle); dam 1m4f winner; jockey booking catches the eye.
